title: Peter Crouch admits he and wife Abbey Clancy WON'T have more kids
text:
He and his wife Abbey Clancy welcomed their fourth child Jack in June and have been happily married since 2011.

And Peter Crouch has revealed the couple will not be having more kids as he admits he 'didn't plan' for their large brood, but insists he feels 'blessed' with two girls and two boys.

During an appearance on the latest edition of Red Stripe Presents: This Feeling TV, the former sportsman, 38, gushed about his role as a doting father while enthusing model Abbey, 33, 'still looks great' after giving birth to four children.

'We're stopping at four': Peter Crouch has revealed he and Abbey Clancy will not be having more kids as he admits he 'didn't plan' for their large brood

The ex-striker retired in July after a successful 21-year football career in a bid to spend more time with daughters Sophia, eight, Liberty, four, and sons Johnny, 21 months, and Jack, four months.

Insisting he's content with four children, the Macclesfield native told hosts Gordon Smart and Laura Whitmore: 'Oh 100% [we are not having another child]!

The former England ace went on to jokingly blame his stunning partner for their huge family: 'It’s her fault I think, she still looks great!

Yummy mummy: The sportsman, 38, gushed about his role as a doting father while enthusing the model, 33, 'looks great' after giving birth (pictured with son Johnny, 21 months, last year)

Doting: The ex-striker retired in July after a successful 21-year football career in a bid to spend more time with children (pictured with son Jack, four months, in September)

Happy family: The couple share daughters Sophia, eight, Liberty, four, and sons Johnny and Jack (pictured last year)

Sharing details: The footballer shed light on his family during an appearance on the latest edition of Red Stripe Presents: This Feeling TV with hosts Gordon Smart and Laura Whitmore

'I don’t know if we planned for four [children] but it’s amazing, I love it! [To have] two boys and two girls, I feel blessed. Being able to take them to school now, pick them up and being hands on.'

Lifting the lid on whether his children will follow in his sporty footsteps, Peter shared: 'The boys are really young, the girls just aren’t interested in football at all, other sports yeah but not football so much.

'I’d love to get the boys into it. I’ll take them to games and definitely they’ll be picking up a golf club and they’ll be playing tennis, as long as they want to.'

What a woman! The former England ace went on to jokingly blame his stunning partner (pictured in January) for their huge family: 'It’s her fault I think, she still looks great!'

Earlier this month, Britain's Next Top Model presenter Abbey revealed her dismay when her husband stopped writing poetry after they got married.

During an appearance on Back Of The Net, the blonde beauty said: 'Actually [he is] a really good poet. He used to write me letters and poetry all the time, until we had four kids then he suddenly stopped.'

She went on to explain how his retirement from football has been different to what she originally expected as 'he's never home'.

The TV host said: 'He sold retirement to me saying we were going to go to the gym together, go to lunch together – I haven’t seen him!'
description: The former sportsman, 38, has revealed the couple will not be having anymore kids as he admitted he 'didn't plan' for their large brood, but has insisted he feels 'blessed' with two girls and two boys.
